document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards for Fine Arts: Music 2024

03869095FEE047B7AB1D29A310C66A7B.description:
Research copyright law and the process for
having a composition protected.

2EB7A0C1BF7048D68215EA94AA6A181F.description:
Develop and articulate a personal
philosophy about the purpose and value of performing
music.

D0537CA1B5C4467298FFF4153D33B877.description:
Explain how the creative process is used in
similar and different ways in the arts.

F158E41B71F6425C9383B727851A3087.description:
Examine how music reflects the social and
political events of history and the role of the musician in
history and culture.

68191D056D79400C8204924A4355BDAE.description: Connecting: Artists/students understand and communicate the value of creative expressions in internal and external contexts.

5125CDCA8F7E4E9F92ECEFB650099A32.description:
Collaborate with the instructor to select music,
successfully rehearse, and present an individual
performance showing mastery of the selected music.

472FA9FE461A4C189C24B92DEC38E6F8.description:
Support interpretations of the expressive intent,
emotion, and meaning of musical works by citing evidence
through appropriate terminology, context, or the setting of
the text and a variety of researched sources.

0C3D15F0D71D4C20805B0965C84C4DC8.description:
Critique the ensemble performance using
established criteria that focuses on pitch, rhythm,
characteristic tone quality and intonation, use of dynamics
and articulation, and appropriate style.

277A4A9D0CBB4E77987D79ABD07F6B3A.description: Responding: Artists/students engage in analysis and interpretation to understand and evaluate artistic works.

C0FF70E5789A4CE7BDFE008428AEBE4C.description:
Respond appropriately to the cues of the
conductor.

9DD4A3517C124F44B8C06105981ADBEF.description:
Develop and apply rehearsal techniques to
address various individual and ensemble challenges in a
varied repertoire of music and evaluate their success in a
rehearsal setting.

E8641CE212A6439E95BD2D4D5C0994BA.description:
Perform a varied repertoire of prepared and
improvised music representing a variety of cultures, styles,
time periods, and genres.

3F4F76627C374B41B977D704F9198CD9.description:
Perform compositions intended for sight reading
with correct pitches, correct rhythms, characteristic tone,
accurate intonation, printed dynamics, printed
articulations, and appropriate style for the music being
performed.

4293794AA2CA484BA18C87B8AF037FC8.description:
Perform prepared or improvised music showing
mastery of technical accuracy and displaying self-initiated
musical expression, phrasing, and emotion.

399213CB742647079DF9E9E212652EB3.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in 10 major and
relative minor key signatures and a chromatic scale in
multiple octaves as appropriate. Demonstrate proficiency
in singing pentatonic; major; natural, harmonic, and
melodic minor scales and keys; plus chromatic and
octatonic scales.

3995851939E24CE2917B70A494173B51.description:
Play or sing with a characteristic tone quality,
perform a full range of pitches with accurate intonation,
understand intonation tendencies, and adjust during the
performance.

7BA34EDB89F04EC9A27F419C81248832.description:
Read and perform with correct pitches, correct
rhythms, printed dynamics, printed articulations, and
appropriate style for the music being performed.

319E98E19DF14D4DA5EC5AA0AC35CD97.description: Performing: Artists/students employ personal processes and skills to solve problems creatively and present work in various contexts.

4E9F030B697349008BC7FF82291C1D83.description:
Compare and contrast techniques of
tuning multiple instruments.

251FC1EFC4F14F5E8FD84B75782A4C21.description:
Evaluate and refine simple
compositions and improvisations based on
established criteria and evaluate if the music meets
the specified criteria.

03AD1FC5F81C4A86A18ABD0A1DA5B3F0.description:
Select, develop, and notate or record
melodic and rhythmic ideas for a specific purpose
that demonstrates characteristics of music from a
variety of cultures.

B03C9A0FE77C4EFE92A2CD1E6532D3F5.description:
Compose and improvise short
compositions for a specific purpose, reflecting
characteristics of music from a variety of cultures.

BC49305213A5419CB50F9C57F8F0B3DC.description: Creating: Artists/students use creative thinking and reasoning skills to perceive concepts and ideas to develop works.
